intro: Gamochaeta aliena, commonly known as the slender false ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, pale purple to white flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Gamochaeta aliena is often found in wetland ecosystems and is considered an indicator species for such environments.
